metadata.title: Customer Billing Complaint via Telegram — Multi-Turn Resolution
metadata.description: A telecom customer reports a billing overcharge via Telegram. The AI bot gathers details through follow-up questions, validates the customer, creates a ticket, and delivers an autonomous resolution.

steps.narration: A customer notices an unexpected charge on their bill and opens their telecom provider's AI support bot on Telegram.
They start with a vague complaint — no account details, no specifics.

steps.value: Hi, I think I was overcharged on my last bill. The amount doesn't look right.

steps.narration: The AI classifies this as a billing complaint but detects missing information — no customer ID, no amount, no billing period.
Instead of rejecting the request, the bot asks targeted follow-up questions — just like a trained agent would.

steps.value: Sure, my customer ID is C005092. I was charged 1499 instead of my usual 999.

steps.narration: The platform validates the customer against the CRM — confirms this is Rajesh Kumar, a Gold-tier subscriber on the 999-rupee plan.
The bot confirms the account and asks for one last detail — the billing month.
All required fields are gathered. The platform creates a trouble ticket and triggers the billing deviation analysis — comparing expected charges against the actual bill.
The bot delivers the resolution — a 500-rupee overcharge from an erroneous add-on has been reversed, a credit applied, and the ticket marked resolved. Three messages, zero human intervention.

Behind this simple conversation, the BlueMarble AI Platform orchestrated intent classification, multi-turn information gathering, CRM validation, ticket creation, and autonomous billing resolution — all within the customer's preferred messaging channel.
